question_text: Select two results of a DHCP server being unavailable when a client requests a new address:
answer_options: The client receives a reserved address from cache
The client may assign itself an APIPA address
The client will fail to join the network until static settings are applied
The client creates a DNS entry to bypass DHCP
The client retries using Bluetooth fallback
correct_answer: The client may assign itself an APIPA address
The client will fail to join the network until static settings are applied
explanation: If DHCP fails, the client may use a fallback address (APIPA) or remain offline until manually configured.
